title: (x) Suggestions for Condensed 1940s font - various {gang}
content:
Morning,   
   
Looking for suggestions for a condensed font with 1930s or 40s flavor that may have an "O" shape like the following...   
   
 ![Condensed O](http://web.archive.org/web/20051110021254im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/43109.gif)   
   
Bolder than this would actually be better.   
Thanks.
author: alyce

comments.content:
Do you mean for the round ends of the 'O' to be kind of flattened?   
   
Stuart :D

Hi Stuart,   
   
No, no flattened top or bottom, please.

Red Rooster has a number of condensed fonts with oblong O's like this. [Schindler](http://web.archive.org/web/20051110021254/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.asp?pid=408955) comes in 5 weights.   
 [Raleigh Gothic Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20051110021254/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.asp?pid=408954) comes in 3 weights, but is more squared perhaps than you want.   
 [Pall Mall](http://web.archive.org/web/20051110021254/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.asp?pid=408922) is another in 2 styles & 2 weights.   
 [Keyboard](http://web.archive.org/web/20051110021254/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.asp?pid=408952) comes in 3 weights.   
 [Helium](http://web.archive.org/web/20051110021254/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.asp?pid=408968) comes in 4 weights.   
 [Grand Canyon](http://web.archive.org/web/20051110021254/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.asp?pid=408986) is all upper case but comes in 8 flavors.   
 [Europa Grotesque](http://web.archive.org/web/20051110021254/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.asp?pid=408905) comes in 4 weights.   
 [Coliseum](http://web.archive.org/web/20051110021254/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.asp?pid=408896) has 3 weights.   
 [Chamfer Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20051110021254/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.asp?pid=408977) has angled corners, 3 weights and 2 styles (other is Small Caps Expert set).   
And last but not least is Block Gothic, which comes in [Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20051110021254/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.asp?pid=408957) & [Extra condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20051110021254/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.asp?pid=408889), with 5 weights of each.   
   
I just happen to have the Red Rooster fonts and I use these a lot when I want condensed styles.

You could try the [Tasse](http://web.archive.org/web/20051110021254/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/tasse/) family. The O is flattened but doesn't have the corners of your sample. Comes in many weights.

Thanks everyone, lots of fonts for me to look at. Armada could be the one -- will keep you posted.   
A.

You did say 40's so I was going to suggest my Hamburger Menu font from the Casino Buffet Font Set: [http://www.fontdiner.com/menu\_vegas.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20051110021254/http:/www.fontdiner.com/menu_vegas.html)   
   
Stuart :D
